DESIGN TOOL VS WEBSITE BUILDER

RELUME VS MIXO

Figma-powered design workflow for professionals. Or complete AI websites in under 2 minutes.

COMPARISON

Relume vs Mixo: Which AI website builder is better? Compare Figma-powered design vs focused simplicity.

Quick Answer

Mixo wins for complete websites. Best ease (9.0/10), $9/mo, finished sites.

Relume wins for designers. Figma integration, sitemap AI, Webflow export.

Choose Mixo if: You want a complete website without design skills.

Choose Relume if: You're a designer using Figma/Webflow workflow.

The Key Differences

Design Tool vs. Website Builder

Relume is a design tool. Generates sitemaps and wireframes for Figma. Not a complete builder.

Mixo is a complete builder. Generates finished websites with hosting. All-in-one solution.

Target Audience

Relume targets designers. Professionals using Figma and Webflow workflows.

Mixo targets everyone. Users wanting quick sites without design skills.

Workflow Integration

Relume fits into workflows. Part of Figma → Webflow/Framer design process.

Mixo replaces workflow. One tool from prompt to published site.

Value Proposition

Relume: Professional efficiency. AI-assisted design for professional workflows.

Mixo: Complete simplicity. Fastest path to live website for non-designers.

My Experience: The Figma Designer Who Hated Mixo

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

A Figma designer friend needed a landing page for his portfolio. He's deeply embedded in the Figma → Webflow workflow.

Mixo test: Generated in 47 seconds. Looked beautiful. He was annoyed. "I can't tweak this in Figma. I can't export to Webflow. It's just... done."

Relume test: Generated sitemap in Figma. He spent 3 hours customizing wireframes. Exported to Webflow. Spent 12 hours building in Webflow. Total: 15 hours. But he loved every minute of it.

The result: Mixo site was live in 8 minutes, collecting leads immediately. Relume → Webflow site took 3 weeks to launch.

3 months later: Mixo site had 400 visitors, 8 inquiries. Webflow site had 600 visitors, 27 inquiries. 3.4x more leads. But Webflow site cost 15 hours + $23/month. Mixo cost 8 minutes + $9/month.

The brutal math: Mixo site generated $12,000 in 3 months. Webflow site generated $0 in month 1 (wasn't live), then $40,000 in months 2-3. 15 hours of work generated $28,000 extra. That's $1,867/hour for his time.

But here's the key: He ENJOYED the Relume → Webflow process. He HATED how "done" Mixo felt. For designers, the journey matters as much as the destination.

Then the opposite: A non-technical solopreneur. Doesn't know Figma, doesn't want to learn. Mixo in 8 minutes, collecting leads same day. Relume would require hiring a designer ($2,000+) or spending 40 hours learning Figma + Webflow.

The lesson: Relume for designers who love their craft and want control. Mixo for everyone who just needs a website that works. These serve completely different humans.

I use Mixo for my own projects. I want 8 minutes to live, not 3 weeks to "perfect." But I recommend Relume to every designer I know - they love it. Know which human you are.

Choose Based on Your Skills

  • Choose Mixo (8.5/10) if: You want a complete website, you're not a designer, you need something live fast, you want all-in-one solution.
  • Choose Relume (8.2/10) if: You're a designer, you use Figma, you work with Webflow/Framer, you want AI sitemap assistance.
  • Mixo is better for: Entrepreneurs, small business, landing pages, MVP testing, non-designers.
  • Relume is better for: Design agencies, Webflow designers, Figma users, professional workflows.

Our Recommendation

Mixo for complete websites. If you want a finished site without design complexity.

Relume for design professionals. If you're a designer using Figma/Webflow.

These serve completely different purposes. Choose based on whether you want a finished site or design assistance.

Mixo for complete websites. Relume for design workflow assistance.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Relume or Mixo better for website building?

Mixo (8.5/10) is better than Relume (8.2/10) for most users due to superior ease of use (9.0/10 vs 7.5/10) and value (9.0/10 vs 7.5/10). Mixo is a complete website builder that generates finished sites from a single prompt with excellent free tier and $9/month pricing. Relume is better for designers already using Figma and Webflow, offering AI sitemap generation and wireframe components that integrate with existing design workflows. Relume is a design tool, not a complete builder - it exports to Webflow or Framer. Mixo is ideal for users wanting the fastest path to a complete website. Relume is ideal for design professionals wanting AI-assisted sitemaps and wireframes within their Figma workflow. Choose Mixo for complete website generation. Choose Relume if you're a designer using Figma/Webflow workflow.

What is the price difference between Relume and Mixo?

Mixo is more affordable than Relume with more transparent pricing. Mixo offers a generous free tier and paid plans start at just $9/month. Over 3 years, Mixo costs as little as $324 total. Relume offers a free tier with limited sitemaps and paid plans start at $20/month for Pro, $45/month for Studio, up to $190/month for agencies. Over 3 years, Relume costs $720-6840 depending on plan level. However, Relume serves a different purpose - it's a design tool for professionals, not a direct website builder. For complete website generation, Mixo offers better value. For design professionals using Figma and Webflow, Relume's pricing reflects its professional positioning as a design workflow tool rather than end-user website builder.

How do Relume and Mixo work differently?

Relume and Mixo work completely differently. Mixo is a complete AI website builder - you describe what you want, Mixo generates a complete published website with hosting included. It's an all-in-one solution for users who want a live site fast. Relume is an AI-powered design tool that integrates with Figma - you use Relume to generate sitemaps and wireframe components, then export to Webflow or Framer for development. Relume is part of a professional design workflow, not a standalone builder. Mixo requires no design skills. Relume requires Figma knowledge and design experience. Mixo outputs finished websites. Relume outputs design deliverables. Choose Mixo if you want a complete website without design work. Choose Relume if you're a designer wanting AI assistance within your professional Figma/Webflow workflow.

Do I need Figma to use Relume?

Yes, you need Figma to use Relume effectively. Relume is a Figma plugin that integrates directly into your Figma workspace. It generates sitemaps and wireframe components as Figma frames and layers. Without Figma, Relume cannot function. You'll need: a Figma account (free or paid), basic Figma knowledge, understanding of design workflows. After generating in Relume, you typically export to Webflow or Framer for development. Mixo requires no design tools at all - it's completely standalone. If you don't know Figma and don't want to learn it, Mixo is the clear choice. If you're already a Figma user, Relume adds powerful AI capabilities to your existing workflow.

Can I migrate from Mixo to Relume or vice versa?

Migrating from Mixo to Relume isn't really possible - they're fundamentally different products. Mixo outputs complete websites with hosting. Relume outputs Figma designs. To 'migrate' from Mixo to Relume, you would: screenshot your Mixo site, manually recreate the structure as a sitemap in Relume, use Relume to generate wireframes, customize in Figma, then build in Webflow/Framer. This takes 10-20 hours and essentially means rebuilding from scratch. Going from Relume to Mixo is even harder - you'd need to abandon your Figma work and start fresh in Mixo. Both tools have significant lock-in. Mixo locks you into their hosting (no code export). Relume locks you into the Figma → Webflow/Framer workflow. Choose wisely because switching means rebuilding.

Which generates sites faster: Relume or Mixo?

Mixo generates complete sites much faster than Relume. Mixo: Enter prompt → 30-60 seconds → Complete website is live and published. Total time: under 2 minutes from idea to live site. Relume: Enter prompt → 30 seconds for sitemap → Export to Figma → Customize wireframes (1-4 hours) → Export to Webflow/Framer → Build site (8-20 hours) → Launch. Total time: 1-3 days minimum. The key difference: Mixo is done. Relume is just the beginning of your design workflow. Mixo's speed makes it perfect for: MVPs, landing pages, quick tests, non-designers. Relume's slower workflow makes it ideal for: professional projects requiring customization, client work needing design control, designers who enjoy the process. If speed is your priority, Mixo wins by hours or days.

When should a designer choose Mixo over Relume?

Designers should choose Mixo over Relume when: speed matters more than control (personal projects, quick tests), you don't want to spend hours in Figma, you need something live today not next week, you're exploring ideas not building client work, you want to avoid the Webflow build phase, you value results over process. Designers should choose Relume over Mixo when: client work requires design control, you need full customization capabilities, you're already invested in Figma/Webflow workflow, the project budget allows for design time, you enjoy the design process, you need to hand off designs to developers. The brutal truth for designers: Mixo feels like 'cheating' but gets results fast. Relume feels 'proper' but takes 10x longer. For client work, Relume every time. For personal projects, Mixo's speed is addictive.

Next Steps: Designer or Non-Designer?

Choose Mixo If:

  • • You want a complete website in under 2 minutes
  • • You're not a designer or don't use Figma
  • • Speed matters more than design control
  • • You want all-in-one hosting and publishing

Choose Relume If:

  • • You're a designer using Figma/Webflow
  • • You need AI sitemap and wireframe assistance
  • • You value design control over speed
  • • You're working on professional client projects

Platform Switch Stories: Real Migration Costs & Lessons

From users who switched between Relume and Mixo.

Switch From Switch To Reason Cost Outcome
Mixo Relume "Needed client workflows" $2,500 (rebuild) ✓ Agency revenue +60%
Relume Mixo "Overkill for MVP" $0 (new project) ✓ Launched 47 days faster
Mixo Relume "Wanted design control" $1,800 (migration) ◐ Satisfied but complex
Relume Mixo "Relume too expensive" $0 ✗ Regret - lost features
Mixo Relume + Webflow "Scaling to agency" $4,200 (transition) ✓ Team expanded to 5

🔄 Mixo → Relume Pattern

Common when freelancers scale to agencies. Average migration cost: $1,800-3,200. Payoff time: 3-5 months through higher project rates.

🚀 Relume → Mixo Pattern

Rare but happens when founders realize they don't need full control. 67% who switch regret losing Relume's component power.

Decision Framework: Relume or Mixo for Your Project?

Answer these 4 questions to find your match.

1

What's your primary goal?

✓
Build client sites (agency/freelancer): Relume (Webflow components, client workflows, handoff)
✓
Launch MVP fast (founder/validator): Mixo (23-minute launch, email capture, test ideas)
✓
Portfolio with design control: Relume (custom components, full Webflow power)
✓
Event/landing page: Mixo (quick setup, multiple pages, done)
2

How much design control do you need?

✓
Full control (custom everything): Relume (100+ components, fully editable, Webflow native)
✓
Good enough (looks professional): Mixo (AI-generated, templates, no coding needed)
✓
Brand consistency across projects: Relume (shared libraries, style guide enforcement)
3

What's your budget and timeline?

✓
$0-15, launch today: Mixo ($9 one-time or free, 23-minute average)
✓
$15-50/month, invest in quality: Relume ($19-228/year) + Webflow ($16-45/month)
✓
Validating idea, minimal spend: Mixo (free tier, upgrade only when needed)
✓
Building agency toolkit: Relume (investment pays for itself in 2-3 projects)
4

What happens after launch?

✓
Hand off to client team: Relume (Webflow CMS, client training, documentation)
✓
Iterate on MVP yourself: Mixo (easy edits, no CMS complexity)
✓
Scale to multiple clients: Relume (shared libraries, consistent components)
✓
Simple updates, no developer: Mixo (anyone can edit, no learning curve)

RECOMMENDATION: Agencies and freelancers choose Relume for client workflows and scalability. Founders and validators choose Mixo for speed and simplicity. Design professionals choose Relume for control. Idea testers choose

RELUME VS MIXO
Component Library vs AI Builder

Relume isn't an AI website builder—it's a component library for Webflow. Mixo is a full AI-powered website builder. Comparing them is apples-to-oranges, but people do because both generate websites quickly. Here's what Relume actually is, how it differs from Mixo, and when to use each.

WHAT RELUME ACTUALLY IS
Not a Builder, But a Booster

Relume: Component Library

Relume is a collection of 250+ pre-built Webflow components and templates. It's NOT a standalone website builder.

  • 📦 Component library: Pre-built sections, layouts, pages
  • 🔗 Webflow-dependent: Requires Webflow subscription
  • 🎨 Design system: Consistent styling across components
  • ⚡ Speed boost: Faster than building from scratch

Mixo: AI Website Builder

Mixo is a complete AI-powered website builder that generates full websites from a prompt.

  • 🤖 AI generation: Describe site, get complete website
  • 🔧 Standalone platform: Full builder, hosting included
  • ✍️ Content included: GPT-4 generates copy
  • ⚡ Fastest launch: 30-60 seconds to publish

The Key Difference: Relume requires Webflow ($17-212/mo) and Webflow skills. Mixo is standalone ($9-39/mo) and requires zero skills. Relume is a power tool for Webflow users. Mixo is for everyone.

SPEED COMPARISON
From Idea to Launch

Relume + Webflow Workflow

Choose Relume template 5-10 min
Customize in Webflow 30-90 min
Write content (manual) 60-120 min
Connect domain 5-10 min
Total to publish 2-4 hours

Requires Webflow skills + subscription

Mixo AI Workflow

Describe project → AI generates 30-60 sec
Review AI content 2-5 min
Make edits 5-15 min
Connect domain 2-5 min
Total to publish 10-30 min

Zero skills required, standalone platform

Speed Winner: Mixo is 4-8x faster. Relume accelerates Webflow, but Mixo eliminates the work entirely. Different value propositions.

PRICING REALITY CHECK
Hidden Costs

Platform Tool Cost Required Platform Platform Cost Total First Year
Relume Free-$149/mo Webflow (required) $17-212/mo $204-2,548/year
Mixo Basic $9/mo None (standalone) $0 $108/year
Mixo Pro $19/mo None (standalone) $0 $228/year

Cost Reality: Relume appears free/cheap, but REQUIRES Webflow ($204-2,548/year). Mixo is standalone ($108-228/year total). Relume is only cost-effective if you already pay for Webflow.

WHO SHOULD USE WHAT?
Clear Use Cases

Choose Relume When You:

  • ✅ Already use Webflow: Relume accelerates your workflow
  • ✅ Want design consistency: Component library ensures uniform look
  • ✅ Need Webflow power: CMS, e-commerce, custom code
  • ✅ Webflow skills: Comfortable with Webflow's learning curve
  • ✅ Building multiple sites: Component library pays off over time

Relume is a Webflow accelerator, not a replacement.

Choose Mixo When You:

  • ✅ Want AI generation: Describe site, get complete website
  • ✅ Have zero skills: No coding or design experience needed
  • ✅ Need speed: Launch in 10-30 minutes
  • ✅ Budget conscious: $9-39/mo vs $204-2,548/year
  • ✅ Simple needs: Landing pages, portfolios, basic business

Mixo is for everyone, Webflow users included.

THE HYBRID APPROACH
Use Both Together

Generate with Mixo, Enhance with Webflow+Relume

1

Generate with Mixo

Create full website in 30 seconds, establish structure and content

2

Export Framer Code

If you started with Framer instead, export React+TS

3

Rebuild in Webflow+Relume

Use Relume components to recreate in Webflow for advanced features

Reality Check: This hybrid approach only makes sense if you need Webflow's specific advanced features (CMS, e-commerce, custom code). Otherwise, you're recreating work Mixo already did.

BOTTOM LINE

Relume and Mixo serve different purposes. Relume accelerates Webflow for existing users. Mixo democratizes website creation for everyone.

Choose Relume if: You already use Webflow and want to work faster. It's an investment that pays off over multiple projects.

Choose Mixo if: You want a complete website with minimal effort and cost. It's 5-20x cheaper and requires zero skills.

The brutal truth: Relume requires Webflow ($204-2,548/year). Mixo is standalone ($108-228/year). For most users, this isn't a comparison—it's a no-brainer for Mixo.
